thread.title: Dave Ewers signs new deal with Exeter Chiefs
thread.title_full: Dave Ewers signs new deal with Exeter Chiefs

title: Dave Ewers signs new deal with Exeter Chiefs
text:
Dave Ewers signs new deal with Exeter Chiefs 22 Oct 2015 08:17:00 
comments 
Exeter have announced that back-row forward Dave Ewers has signed a contract extension with the Aviva Premiership club. 
Ewers' two-year deal will tie him to the Chiefs until 2018. His existing contract expires at the end of this season. 
The 24-year-old has represented England Saxons and he looks set to be a serious contender for England's RBS 6 Nations squad later this term. 
"There is no doubt that Dave is one of the best young back-row forwards in the country," Exeter head coach Rob Baxter said. 
"I think in many people's opinion he was unlucky not to be in or around that (England) World Cup group, come the end of the season. 
"If Dave continues to improve in the way that he is and plays in the manner that he plays and does things as well as he does - particularly if we show success as a side - then I am sure that international recognition is just around the corner for him." Related Sport News
